Job Title: Senior Coatings and Materials Engineer - Washington, D.C.
Job Description:
Position Description :

If you seek a rewarding, high profile and challenging position supporting projects for the US Navy- Serco has a wonderful opportunity for you!

As the Senior Coatings and Materials Engineer, you will provide support to Team Submarine and provide direct support to the technical branch of one of our customers on an active contract with the U.S. Navy in the Washington, DC area. Bring your expertise and collaborative skills to make an impact towards our military defense and safety of our sailors.

Team Submarine’s Submarine Program Offices are responsible for the acquisition of the nuclear submarines, PMS397 the COLUMBIA Class, PMS450 the VIRGINIA Class, and for SSN(X), the future fast attack submarines. Team Submarine offices are also responsible for identifying, assembling, managing, directing, and coordinating the resources required for the R&D, design, construction, Test and Evaluation (T&E) and Live Fire Test and Evaluation (LFT&E) of the submarines. These programs are major defense acquisition programs and is of significant political importance with Congress and the Office of the Secretary of Defense (OSD).

Serco supports the US Navy as a prime for their Team Submarine contract supporting the acquisition of submarines. The Team Submarine concept unifies once diverse submarine-related activities into a single submarine-centric organization with the goal of eliminating traditional stovepipe structures and processes that created impediments and inefficiencies in the submarine research, development, acquisition, and maintenance communities. Team Submarine provides improved communication among the various offices that contribute to the overall success of the United States Submarine Force.

In this role, you will:
• Report to the General Requirements SIT Lead, as required.
• Provide direct support to senior Serco staff and the Navy General Requirements SIT to resolve VIRGINIA Class construction issues in support of on-time production and delivery of Submarines.
• Support PMS450 evaluation of proposed designs and arrangements from a materials compatibility and/or metallic corrosion perspective.
• Identify technical issues related to materials, welding, NDT, and/or allied processes in submittals from shipbuilders, supervisors of shipbuilding, PARMs and other members of the submarine community.
• Adjudicate liabilities identified by the shipbuilders to support submarine certification, including liabilities which impact the SUBSAFE, DSS-SOC, and Level 1 programs.
• Work with applicable SITs to facilitate resolution of technical issues and act as a liaison with other PMS450 team members and NAVSEA05 Technical Warrant Holders (TWH).
• Facilitate timely decisions and review and adjudication of all design products and written correspondence.
• Review, assess, and analyze technical reports covering Navy submarine hull, mechanical, and electrical (HM&E) components with a focus on coatings materials such as adhesives, vibration control materials, seals, coatings, and thermal, acoustic, and electrical insulation but including other materials and components, as required.
• Identify, review, and assess relevant specifications, drawings, standards, and requirements documents to support preparation of technical solutions.
• In collaboration with senior Serco and Navy staff, prepare timely written technical assessments and decision papers, letters and packages for official release.
• Interface with technical stakeholders including shipbuilders, shipyards, maintenance facilities, and technical authorities to generate technical solutions and support preparation of technical decision papers, letters and packages for official release.
• Organize and maintain electronic directory of technical papers, letters, and packages for efficient and timely retrieval.
• Track and report status of commitments.
• Attend applicable meetings required to support the SIT Lead and prepare monthly progress reports and an annual statement of accomplishments.

Qualifications:

To be successful in this role you will have:
• An Active or Current DoD Secret clearance.
• US Citizenship
• Bachelor's Degree, in engineering or related technical field preferred.
• An Associate's Degree and 2 years of additional experience or a High School Diploma/GED and 4 years of additional experience and cybersecurity certifications will be considered in lieu of Bachelor's Degree.
• 12 years of experience (Experience with Navy acquisition and Submarine Programs highly preferred).
• Higher level of education such as a Masters Degree in engineering or related technical field will be considered in lieu of experience.
• Ability to understand and clearly summarize, communicate, and document technical issues.
• Experience writing technical papers and an ability to adapt to Navy-prescribed formats and styles.
• Ability to research and assimilate technical information covering shipboard HM&E systems, components, and processes.
• Knowledge of Navy shipboard and submarine systems, and DOD acquisition programs, preferred.
• Knowledge of Material coatings on Submarine hulls reduce drag, enhance stealth and prevent marine growth, enhancing their durability and performance
• Knowledge/experience with new and advanced materials used on submarines such as omniphobic coatings, Superhydrophobic Hull Coatings, materials necessary to prevent microfouling, and anechoic tiles of rubber or synthetic polymer tiles required.
• Knowledge of other materials and components, such as metals (ferrous and non-ferrous) and fasteners and knowledge of other processes, such as welding, non-destructive testing, and corrosion control, preferred.
• Familiarity with non-metallic material specifications, standards, and technical data sheets.
• Professional knowledge and experience with non-metallic materials including applications, properties, testing, limitations, and installation requirements.
• Ability to use a variety of software products (e.g., MS Office, MS Outlook) and information systems (e.g., TeamCenter).
• Proven excellent interpersonal skills.
• Ability to multitask effectively.
• Strong leadership and problem-solving skills to assist with the daily operation of the program office.
• Strongly developed written and verbal communication skills.
• Ability to travel up to 10% of the time.

Additional desired experience and skills:
• Submarine experience
• Experience as a project manager
• Active NNPI account and CAC
• 10 years of experience with Navy acquisition and Submarine Programs.
• Experience leading a project and interfacing with an end item customer.
• Knowledge of Program Management, including the acquisition process, the budgeting process and Navy program execution.
• Active-Duty Experience in submarines.
• Recent experience in Team Submarine

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your automation and quality assurance experience to a world class organization that is leading the way in both content and technology to serve and protect our citizens home and abroad? Do you have the skills necessary to deliver high quality client solutions? Then TRSS is looking for you!

About the Role

As an Automation QA Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and reviewing automated solutions, delivering high quality tests and code contributions. You will be responsible for creating and executing test plans to support multiple products. As an Automation QA Engineer, you will also contribute to a variety of areas including:
• Test Planning and Analysis
• Reviews business requirements and design specifications for moderately complex changes/systems for completeness and testability
• Analyze and understand testing procedures and requirements
• Obtain requirements from stakeholders and end-users to find automation solutions that align with development and QA goals
• Automation Design and Execution
• Identify opportunities to automate the team’s process and operations
• Design, develop and execute QA tests with effective automation scripts
• Ensure that the automation solutions implemented thoroughly cover all necessary aspects of a product and lead to the resolution of any errors found
• Ensure automation work leads to a more efficient testing strategy and a higher quality product
• Collaboration and Communication
• Provides inputs and escalates issues in bug triage meetings and coordinates with development team
• Responsible for staying highly engaged with product sprint ceremonies
• Track, manage and report on automation progress and goals
• Industry Trends and Continuous Improvement
• Stays current with automation industry trends and technologies that will impact the business

About You

You’re a good fit for the role of Automation QA Engineer if you have:
• Minimum 5 years’ experience in Quality Assurance
• Proficiency in writing clean, modular, reusable code - preferably Java or JavaScript
• Experience using testing tools such as Playwright is preferred
• Experience with Backend and Frontend testing and API test automation
• Comprehensive understanding of test methodologies and techniques
• Experience working in agile development environment
• Have a systematic, disciplined, and analytical approach
• Ability to understand performance guidelines to achieve results
• Ability to adapt to changing priorities in accordance with organizational needs
• Ability to provide consistent effort and to work within provided deadlines
• Ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. national security clearance
• U.S. Citizenship essential to comply with government contract/agency or department of Federal Government requirements

These benefits meet or exceeds the requirements of paid time off in accordance with any applicable state or municipal laws. Finally, Thomson Reuters offers the following additional benefits: optional hospital, accident and sickness insurance paid 100% by the employee; optional life and AD&D insurance paid 100% by the employee; Flexible Spending and Health Savings Accounts; fitness reimbursement; access to Employee Assistance Program; Group Legal Identity Theft Protection benefit paid 100% by employee; access to 529 Plan; commuter benefits; Adoption & Surrogacy Assistance; Tuition Reimbursement; and access to Employee Stock Purchase Plan.

About Peraton

Peraton is a next-generation national security company that drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world's leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted, highly differentiated solutions and technologies to protect our nation and allies. Each day, our employees do the can't be done by solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers. Visit peraton.com to learn how we're keeping people around the world safe and secure.

Program Overview

Scientific, engineering, and acoustic data analysis in support of the U.S. Navy's Signatures Directorate. Operations include assisting with submarine sonar sensor testing, designing acoustic measurement systems, developing signature materials, and performing research and development for the fleet.

About The Role

Peraton is looking for a R&D Mechanical Engineer to join our team in West Bethesda, MD. This position supports the US Navy's Signature Physics Program. This program directly supports US Navy warfighters by performing research, development, and test of signature control technologies on US Navy platforms.

This is a full time onsite position in West Bethesda, MD.

What you'll do:

This high visibility position performs rapid design, fabrication, installation, and test of naval platform signature control R&D articles. The successful candidate will participate in all phases of the development of test articles. Routine activities will include:
• Use Solidworks to design R&D test items from polymers, metals, and wood
• Perform design of articles using experimental materials that meet government specified physical criteria
• Assist in fabrication using shop tools (band saws, drill press, etc) and hand tools (sanders, grinders, etc)
• Coordinate with and direct technicians performing fabrication
• Design and perform tests on fabricated components. Support third party component testing.
• Support installation and test of components on model scale and full scale platform
• Support article installation and test activities at shipyards and other NSWCCD sites
• Develop briefs and presentations on articles designed

Qualifications

Required Education and Experience:
• Bachelor's Degree in Engineering and 5-7 years of experience or Master's Degree in Engineering and 3-5 years of experience. PhD 0+ years of experience. Mechanical Engineering preferred.
• Experience with Solidworks
• Experienced with MS Office Suite
• Active DoD SECRET clearance
• Fabrication experience with shop tools (band saws, drill press, etc) and hand tools (sanders, grinders, etc)
Desired:
• Component test design and execution experience
• Shipyard Experience

SCA / Union / Intern Rate or Range

Details
